intro: Fobea viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered fobea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
